Study Objectives
The project aims to detect changes in mood and stress levels, by analyzing data obtained from the smartwatch sensors and the spoken diary recordings.

Send Log
Our advice

Walk briskly for 15 to 30 minutes each day, or dance, run or ride a bike, if you prefer. Depressed people don\'t usually feel like being active, but make yourself do it anyway (ask a friend to join you to stay motivated). Once you make exercise a habit, it won\'t take long to notice a positive change in your mood. Aside from aerobic exercise, some yoga poses can help relieve depressed feelings.

Depression can affect appetite. When depressed, some people don\'t feel like eating at all, but others may eat too much. If depression has affected your eating habits, you will need to be very aware of the need to eat well. Nutrition can influence a person\'s mood and energy level.

Try to identify the circumstances that have contributed to your depression. Once you know what has made you feel sad and down and why, and have aired those thoughts and feelings, focus attention on something positive. Take action to solve your problems.

When a person is depressed, they may have blocked creativity and the ability to enjoy things. Exercise your imagination (painting, drawing, doodling, sewing, writing, dancing, composing music, etc.) and you will not only get your creative juices flowing but you may also experience positive emotions. Spend time playing with a friend or your pet or do something fun alone.

Depression has an impact on people\'s thoughts, making everything seem black, disastrous, sad and negative. If depression is making you focus only on the negative, make an effort to focus on the good things in life. As an exercise you can make a list of positive things that happened to you in your day; this will help you realize that you can find positive sides to even the smallest of things.
Avoidance is a defense mechanism that, in the short term, \"protects\" you from experiencing difficult emotions but, in the long term, can generate a greater degree of depression.
A typical characteristic of depression is losing interest in achieving goals or objectives. Setting goals, whether big or small, is an important means to overcome depression.

Have hobbies and practice them as much as you can. It will make you feel alive. Whatever happens, don’t forget to reserve moments for yourself and to do what you enjoy. Don\'t let your mood determine your activity level.
Don\'t close in on yourself, it is important that you remove your armor and let someone know how you feel. Remember that life is too short to suffer longer than necessary.
Start moving TODAY! Take the first step NOW and step by step you will overcome depression and regain your vitality.

Alias
I found it hard to wind down.
I was aware of dryness of my mouth.
I experienced breathing difficulty (e.g. excessively rapid breathing, breathlessness in the absence of physical exertion).
I found it difficult to work up the initiative to do things.
I tended to over-react to situations.
I experienced trembling (e.g. in the hands).
OK

string-array.name: dropdown_array
string-array.item: 1 Me ha ocurrido un poco, o durante parte del tiempo
2 Me ha ocurrido bastante, o durante una buena parte del tiempo
3 Me ha ocurrido mucho, o la mayor parte del tiempo

resources.string: I couldn’t seem to experience any positive feeling at all.
I felt that I was using a lot of nervous energy.
I was worried about situations in which I might panic and make a fool of myself.
I felt that I had nothing to look forward to.
I found myself getting agitated.
I found it difficult to relax.
I felt down-hearted and blue.
I was intolerant of anything that kept me from getting on with what I was doing.
I felt I was close to panic.
I was unable to become enthusiastic about anything.
I felt I wasn’t worth much as a person.
I felt that I was rather touchy.
I was aware of the action of my heart in the absence of physical exertion (e.g. sense of heart rate increase, heart missing a beat).
I felt scared without any good reason.
I felt that life was meaningless.

Please read each statement and circle a number, 0, 1, 2 or 3, to indicate how much the statement applied to you over the past week. There are no right or wrong answers. Do not spend too much time on any statement.

What kind of things do you enjoy?
Some people prefer to spend time with other people, while others prefer to work and do things alone. How would you describe yourself?
Do you usually avoid taking chances or trying new activities because you’re worried about embarrassing yourself? Why?
Do you often turn to others for advice about everyday decisions like what to have for lunch or what clothes to buy?

Some people turn to others to make decisions about important areas of their life. For example, they let someone else decide whether they should take a job, who their friends should be, etc. Does this sound like your life?
Do you usually need help from somebody else to get started on a project or do things on your own? Why is that?
After you pay your bills, what kinds of things do you like to spend money on? Are you slow to spend money on yourself?
Some people worry so much about something terrible happening in the future, that they hold on to all their money. Does this sound like you? Tell me about that.
When you have a chance to do something that’s fun, is it hard to enjoy it? Have you always been this way?
Is it hard for you to admit that you’ve had a good time? Have you always been this way?
Do you usually turn down opportunities to have a good time? Why is this?
Would you call yourself a workaholic? Why or why not?
Have others complained about how much time you spend working? Why do you think is that?
Do you enjoy a job that requires a lot of interaction with other people, or do you try to avoid that kind of work? Why is that?
Have you ever turned down a job or promotion because it involved more contact with people? Why is that?
What motivates you? What are you passionate about?
Not everyone agrees all the time. Have you had a peer, teammate or friend disagree with you? What did you do?
Give an example of a time you have gone over and above to achieve something. Why was it important for you to achieve this?
Sometimes things don’t always go to plan. Describe a time when you failed in something? What did you do? How did that make you feel?
Tell me about your social life. What have you been doing together with other people?
How do you feel about the way things are going for you?

"Please call Stella. Ask her to bring these things with her from the store: Six spoons of fresh snow peas, five thick slabs of blue cheese, and maybe a snack for her brother Bob. We also need a small plastic snake and a big toy frog for the kids. She can scoop these things into three red bags, and we will go meet her Wednesday at the train station. "
Mental Wellness Supports
Counseling and clinical services at the U of A
Book an initial consultation by calling 780-492-5205 or visit the clinic in 2-600 SUB between the hours of 8:00am-4:00pm, Monday through Friday.
U of A students who do not currently reside in Alberta can connect with doshelp@ualberta.ca for additional support.
Please note that counseling services through this program are not meant for urgent or crisis situations
ACCESS 24/7
Connect with a mental health therapist or psychiatrist
Available for urgent and crisis situations
Phone 780-424-2424 or drop-in through Anderson Hall (at the Royal Alexandra Hospital) at 10959 102 St NW, Edmonton, AB T5H 2V1
24 Hour Distress/Crisis Line 780-482-4357
If you are experiencing suicidal thoughts with a specific plan and/or do not feel you can keep yourself safe call 9-1-1 or go to the Emergency Department.
